org.apache.james.mailbox.store

Class StoreMessageManager<Id>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.james.mailbox.store.StoreMessageManager<Id>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HBaseMessageManager, JCRMessageManager, JPAMessageManager

    public class StoreMessageManager<Id>
extends Object
implements MessageManager
    Base class for MessageManager implementations. This base class take care of dispatching events to the registered MailboxListener and so help with handling concurrent MailboxSession's.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.james.mailbox.MessageManager

        Be sure this static instance will never get modifed later!

      • getPermanentFlags

        protected javax.mail.Flags getPermanentFlags(MailboxSession session)
        Return Flags which are permanent stored by the mailbox. By default this are the following flags:
        Flags.Flag.ANSWERED, Flags.Flag.DELETED, Flags.Flag.DRAFT, Flags.Flag.FLAGGED, Flags.Flag.RECENT, Flags.Flag.SEEN
        Which in fact does not allow to permanent store user flags / keywords. If the sub-class does allow to store "any" user flag / keyword it MUST override this method and add Flags.Flag.USER to the list of returned Flags. If only a special set of user flags / keywords should be allowed just add them directly.
        Parameters:
        session -
        Returns:
        flags

      • getSharedPermanentFlags

        protected javax.mail.Flags getSharedPermanentFlags(MailboxSession session)
        Returns the flags which are shared for the current mailbox, i.e. the flags set up so that changes to those flags are visible to another user. See RFC 4314 section 5.2. In this implementation, all permanent flags are shared, ergo we simply return getPermanentFlags(MailboxSession)
        Parameters:
        session -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        UnionMailboxACLResolver#isReadWrite(MailboxACLRights, Flags)

      • isModSeqPermanent

        public boolean isModSeqPermanent(MailboxSession session)
        Return true. If an subclass don't want to store mod-sequences in a permanent way just override this and return false
        Specified by:
        isModSeqPermanent in interface MessageManager
        Returns:
        true

      • appendMessage

        public long appendMessage(InputStream msgIn,
                 Date internalDate,
                 MailboxSession mailboxSession,
                 boolean isRecent,
                 javax.mail.Flags flagsToBeSet)
                   throws MailboxException
        Description copied from interface: MessageManager
        Appends a message to this mailbox. This method must return a higher UID as the last call in every case which also needs to be unique for the lifetime of the mailbox.
        Specified by:
        appendMessage in interface MessageManager
        internalDate - the time of addition to be set, not null
        mailboxSession - not null
        isRecent - true when the message should be marked recent, false otherwise
        flagsToBeSet - optionally set these flags on created message, or null when no additional flags should be set
        Returns:
        uid for the newly added message
        Throws:
        MailboxException - when message cannot be appended
        See Also:
        MessageManager.appendMessage(java.io.InputStream, java.util.Date, org.apache.james.mailbox.MailboxSession, boolean, javax.mail.Flags)

      • listRigths

        public MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights[] listRigths(MailboxACL.MailboxACLEntryKey key,
                                       MailboxSession session)
                                         throws UnsupportedRightException
        Description copied from interface: MessageManager
        Computes a result suitable for the LISTRIGHTS IMAP command. The result is computed for this mailbox and the given identifier. From RFC 4314 section 3.7: The first element of the resulting array contains the (possibly empty) set of rights the identifier will always be granted in the mailbox. Following this are zero or more right sets the identifier can be granted in the mailbox. Rights mentioned in the same set are tied together. The server MUST either grant all tied rights to the identifier in the mailbox or grant none. The same right MUST NOT be listed more than once in the LISTRIGHTS command.
        Specified by:
        listRigths in interface MessageManager
        Parameters:
        key - the identifier from the LISTRIGHTS command.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UnsupportedRightException
        See Also:
        org.apache.james.mailbox.MessageManager#listRigths(java.lang.String, org.apache.james.mailbox.MailboxSession)
